intro: Piqueria ageratoides, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its small, white to pale purple flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Piqueria ageratoides is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of ornamental plants.
